001package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
012
013import java.nio.Buffer;
014
015/**
016 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
017 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the H, S, and L channels of a color by multiplication (called the
018 * "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
019 * {@code Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the HSLuv color space where
020 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, red maps to additive H (hue), green maps to
021 * additive S (saturation), blue maps to additive L (lightness), and alpha continues to be multiplicative alpha.
022 * Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at
023 * 0.0. In the tweak, red maps to multiplicative H, green maps to multiplicative S, blue maps to multiplicative L, and
024 * alpha maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative
025 * values, but you can think of the existing color as being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the HSL
026 * channels, so each HSL channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times
027 * 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values for S that are less than 0.5 make colors closer to grayscale and
028 * values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is a special
029 * value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make L changes less distinct between similar colors, while
030 * higher values will "sharpen" the changes in L.
031 * <br>
032 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 1/21/2021.
033 */
034public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
035    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
036    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
037
038    private Mesh mesh;
039
040    private final float[] vertices;
041    private int idx = 0;
042    private Texture lastTexture = null;
043    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
044
045    private boolean drawing = false;
046
047    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
048    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
049    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
050
051    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
052    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
053    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
054    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
055    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
056
057    private final ShaderProgram shader;
058    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
059    private boolean ownsShader;
060
061    protected float color = ColorTools.hsluv(0f, 0f, 128f/255f, 1f);
062    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0f, 0f, 128f/255f, 1f); // HSL from Palette.GRAY
063
064    /**
065     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
066     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
067     * L multiplier or contrast, and it won't change the A multiplier or the B multiplier.
068     */
069    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.hsluv(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
070    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
071
072    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
073    public int renderCalls = 0;
074
075    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
076    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
077
078    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
079    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
080
081    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
082     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
083    public ColorfulBatch() {
084        this(1000, null);
085    }
086
087    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
088     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
089    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
090        this(size, null);
091    }
092
093    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
094     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
095     * respect to the current screen resolution.
096     * <p>
097     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
098     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
099     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 10922.
100     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
101    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
102        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 6 vertices per sprite = 10922 sprites max.
103        if (size > 10922) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 10922 sprites per batch: " + size);
104
105        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
106
107        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
108                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
109                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
110                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
111                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
112
113        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
114
115        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
116
117        int len = size * 6;
118        short[] indices = new short[len];
119        short j = 0;
120        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
121            indices[i] = j;
122            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
123            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
124            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
125            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
126            indices[i + 5] = j;
127        }
128        mesh.setIndices(indices);
129
130        if (defaultShader == null) {
131            shader = createDefaultShader();
132            ownsShader = true;
133        } else
134            shader = defaultShader;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
139     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
140     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
141     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
142     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
143     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
144     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
145     */
146    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
147        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
148                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
149                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
150                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
151                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
152                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
153                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
154                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
155                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
156                "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
157                "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
158                "const mat3 m =" +
159                "         mat3(+3.2404542, -1.5371385, -0.4985314,\n" +
160                "              -0.9692660, +1.8760108, +0.0415560,\n" +
161                "              +0.0556434, -0.2040259, +1.0572252);\n" +
162                "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
163                "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
164                "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
165                "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
166                "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
167                "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
168                "        float result = 1.0e50;\n" +
169                "        float top, rbottom, lbottom, bottom, C0, C1;\n" +
170                "        vec3 channelM;\n" +
171                "        channelM = m[0];\n" +
172                "        top = (0.99915 * channelM.x + 1.05122 * channelM.y + 1.14460 * channelM.z) * sub2;\n" +
173                "        rbottom = 0.86330 * channelM.z - 0.17266 * channelM.y;\n" +
174                "        lbottom = 0.12949 * channelM.z - 0.38848 * channelM.x;\n" +
175                "        bottom = (rbottom * sn + lbottom * cs) * sub2;\n" +
176                "        C0 = lightness * top / bottom;\n" +
177                "        if (C0 > 0. && C0 < result) {\n" +
178                "          result = C0;\n" +
179                "        }\n" +
180                "        C1 = lightness * (top - 1.05122 * 1) / (bottom + 0.17266 * sn);\n" +
181                "        if (C1 > 0. && C1 < result) {\n" +
182                "          result = C1;\n" +
183                "        }\n" +
184                "        channelM = m[1];\n" +
185                "        top = (0.99915 * channelM.x + 1.05122 * channelM.y + 1.14460 * channelM.z) * sub2;\n" +
186                "        rbottom = 0.86330 * channelM.z - 0.17266 * channelM.y;\n" +
187                "        lbottom = 0.12949 * channelM.z - 0.38848 * channelM.x;\n" +
188                "        bottom = (rbottom * sn + lbottom * cs) * sub2;\n" +
189                "        C0 = lightness * top / bottom;\n" +
190                "        if (C0 > 0. && C0 < result) {\n" +
191                "          result = C0;\n" +
192                "        }\n" +
193                "        C1 = lightness * (top - 1.05122 * 1) / (bottom + 0.17266 * sn);\n" +
194                "        if (C1 > 0. && C1 < result) {\n" +
195                "          result = C1;\n" +
196                "        }\n" +
197                "        channelM = m[2];\n" +
198                "        top = (0.99915 * channelM.x + 1.05122 * channelM.y + 1.14460 * channelM.z) * sub2;\n" +
199                "        rbottom = 0.86330 * channelM.z - 0.17266 * channelM.y;\n" +
200                "        lbottom = 0.12949 * channelM.z - 0.38848 * channelM.x;\n" +
201                "        bottom = (rbottom * sn + lbottom * cs) * sub2;\n" +
202                "        C0 = lightness * top / bottom;\n" +
203                "        if (C0 > 0. && C0 < result) {\n" +
204                "          result = C0;\n" +
205                "        }\n" +
206                "        C1 = lightness * (top - 1.05122 * 1) / (bottom + 0.17266 * sn);\n" +
207                "        if (C1 > 0. && C1 < result) {\n" +
208                "          result = C1;\n" +
209                "        }\n" +
210                "        return result;\n" +
211                "}\n" +
212//                "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
213//                "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
214//                "}\n" +
215//                "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
216//                "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
217//                "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
218//                "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
219//                "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
220//                "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
221//                "        float mn = 1000.0;\n" +
222//                "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
223//                "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
224//                "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
225//                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
226//                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
227//                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
228//                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
229//                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
230//                "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
231//                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
232//                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
233//                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
234//                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
235//                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
236//                "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
237//                "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
238//                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
239//                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
240//                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
241//                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
242//                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
243//                "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
244//                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
245//                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
246//                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
247//                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
248//                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
249//                "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
250//                "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
251//                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
252//                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
253//                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
254//                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
255//                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
256//                "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
257//                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
258//                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
259//                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
260//                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
261//                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
262//                "        return mn;\n" +
263//                "}\n" +
264                "vec3 hsl2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
265                "{\n" +
266                "    float L = c.z;\n" +
267                "    float C = chromaLimit(c.x, L) * c.y;\n" +
268                "    float U = cos(c.x) * C;\n" +
269                "    float V = sin(c.x) * C;\n" +
270                "    return vec3(L, U, V);\n" +
271                "}\n"
272                + "void main()\n"
273                + "{\n"
274                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
275                + "   v_tweak.w = pow(v_tweak.w * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
276                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
277                + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
278                + "   v_color.x *= 6.2831 * 2.0 * v_tweak.x;\n"
279                + "   v_color.rgb = hsl2luv(v_color.rgb);\n"
280                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
281                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
282                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
283                + "}\n";
284        String fragmentShader =
285                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
286                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
287                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
288                        "#else\n" +
289                        "#define LOWP \n" +
290                        "#endif\n" +
291                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
292                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
293                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
294                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
295                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
296                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
297                        "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
298                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
299                        "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
300                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
301                        "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
302                        "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
303                        "const vec2 refUV = vec2(0.1978, 0.4683);\n" +
304                        "const mat3 m =" +
305                        "         mat3(+3.2404542, -1.5371385, -0.4985314,\n" +
306                        "              -0.9692660, +1.8760108, +0.0415560,\n" +
307                        "              +0.0556434, -0.2040259, +1.0572252);\n" +
308                        "const mat3 mInv =" +
309                        "         mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
310                        "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
311                        "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
312                        "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
313                        "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
314                        "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon.x)); }\n" +
315                        "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
316                        "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
317                        "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
318                        "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
319                        "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
320                        "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
321                        "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
322                        "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
323                        "        float result = 1.0e50;\n" +
324                        "        float top, rbottom, lbottom, bottom, C0, C1;\n" +
325                        "        vec3 channelM;\n" +
326                        "        channelM = m[0];\n" +
327                        "        top = (0.99915 * channelM.x + 1.05122 * channelM.y + 1.14460 * channelM.z) * sub2;\n" +
328                        "        rbottom = 0.86330 * channelM.z - 0.17266 * channelM.y;\n" +
329                        "        lbottom = 0.12949 * channelM.z - 0.38848 * channelM.x;\n" +
330                        "        bottom = (rbottom * sn + lbottom * cs) * sub2;\n" +
331                        "        C0 = lightness * top / bottom;\n" +
332                        "        if (C0 > 0. && C0 < result) {\n" +
333                        "          result = C0;\n" +
334                        "        }\n" +
335                        "        C1 = lightness * (top - 1.05122 * 1) / (bottom + 0.17266 * sn);\n" +
336                        "        if (C1 > 0. && C1 < result) {\n" +
337                        "          result = C1;\n" +
338                        "        }\n" +
339                        "        channelM = m[1];\n" +
340                        "        top = (0.99915 * channelM.x + 1.05122 * channelM.y + 1.14460 * channelM.z) * sub2;\n" +
341                        "        rbottom = 0.86330 * channelM.z - 0.17266 * channelM.y;\n" +
342                        "        lbottom = 0.12949 * channelM.z - 0.38848 * channelM.x;\n" +
343                        "        bottom = (rbottom * sn + lbottom * cs) * sub2;\n" +
344                        "        C0 = lightness * top / bottom;\n" +
345                        "        if (C0 > 0. && C0 < result) {\n" +
346                        "          result = C0;\n" +
347                        "        }\n" +
348                        "        C1 = lightness * (top - 1.05122 * 1) / (bottom + 0.17266 * sn);\n" +
349                        "        if (C1 > 0. && C1 < result) {\n" +
350                        "          result = C1;\n" +
351                        "        }\n" +
352                        "        channelM = m[2];\n" +
353                        "        top = (0.99915 * channelM.x + 1.05122 * channelM.y + 1.14460 * channelM.z) * sub2;\n" +
354                        "        rbottom = 0.86330 * channelM.z - 0.17266 * channelM.y;\n" +
355                        "        lbottom = 0.12949 * channelM.z - 0.38848 * channelM.x;\n" +
356                        "        bottom = (rbottom * sn + lbottom * cs) * sub2;\n" +
357                        "        C0 = lightness * top / bottom;\n" +
358                        "        if (C0 > 0. && C0 < result) {\n" +
359                        "          result = C0;\n" +
360                        "        }\n" +
361                        "        C1 = lightness * (top - 1.05122 * 1) / (bottom + 0.17266 * sn);\n" +
362                        "        if (C1 > 0. && C1 < result) {\n" +
363                        "          result = C1;\n" +
364                        "        }\n" +
365                        "        return result;\n" +
366                        "}\n" +
367                        "vec3 rgb2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
368                        "{\n" +
369                        "    c *= mInv;" +
370                        "    float L = max(0.,1.16*pow(c.y, 1.0 / 3.0) - 0.16);\n" +
371                        "    vec2 uv;\n" +
372                        "    if(L < 0.0001) uv = vec2(0.0);\n" +
373                        "    else uv = 13. * L * (vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) - refUV);\n" +
374                        "    return vec3(L, uv);\n" +
375                        "}\n" +
376//                        "vec3 rgb2hsl(vec3 c)\n" +
377//                        "{\n" +
378//                        "    c *= mInv" +
379//                        "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
380//                        "    float L = max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16);\n" +
381//                        "    vec2 uv = L / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) * vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy - refUV;\n" +
382//                        "    vec3 luv = vec3(L, uv);\n" +
383//                        "    float C = length(uv);\n" +
384//                        "    float h = atan(uv.y, uv.x);\n" +
385//                        "    float s = min(C / (chromaLimit(L, h) + 0.0001), 1);\n" +
386//                        "    return vec3(h, s, L);\n" +
387//                        "}\n" +
388//                        "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
389//                        "{\n" +
390//                        "    float L = c.x;\n" +
391//                        "    float U = c.y;\n" +
392//                        "    float V = c.z;\n" +
393//                        "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
394//                        "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
395//                        "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
396//                        "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
397//                        "    } else {\n" +
398//                        "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
399//                        "        float prop = c.y * c.y * c.y;\n" +
400//                        "        if(prop > epsilon.x) c.y = prop;\n" +
401//                        "        else c.y = (1.16 * c.y - 0.16) / kappa;\n" +
402//                        "    }\n" +
403//                        "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
404//                        "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
405//                        "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
406//                        "    c.x = -9. * c.y * varU / (-4. * varV);\n" +
407//                        "    c.z = (9 * c.y - 15 * varV * c.y - varV * c.x) / (3 * varV);\n" +
408//                        "    vec3 rgb = c * mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
409//                        "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
410//                        "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
411//                        "    return rgb;\n" +
412//                        "}\n" +
413                        "float forwardLight(float L) {\n" +
414                        "        const float shape = 0.8528, turning = 0.1;\n" +
415                        "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
416                        "        return mix(\n" +
417                        "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
418                        "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
419                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
420                        "}\n" +
421                        "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
422                        "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
423                        "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
424                        "        return mix(\n" +
425                        "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
426                        "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
427                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
428                        "}\n" +
429                        "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
430                        "{\n" +
431                        "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
432                        "    float U = c.y;\n" +
433                        "    float V = c.z;\n" +
434                        "    float lim = chromaLimit(atan(V, U), L);\n" +
435                        "    float len = length(vec2(U,V));\n" +
436                        "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
437                        "      lim /= len;\n" +
438                        "      U *= lim;\n" +
439                        "      V *= lim;\n" +
440                        "    }\n" +
441                        "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
442                        "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
443                        "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
444                        "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
445                        "    } else {\n" +
446                        "      if (L <= 0.08) {\n" +
447                        "        c.y = L / kappa;\n" +
448                        "      } else {\n" +
449                        "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
450                        "        c.y *= c.y * c.y;\n" +
451                        "      }\n" +
452                        "    }\n" +
453                        "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
454                        "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
455                        "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
456                        "    c.x = 9. * varU * c.y / (4. * varV);\n" +
457                        "    c.z = (3. * c.y / varV) - c.x / 3. - 5. * c.y;\n" +
458                        "    vec3 rgb = c * mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
459                        "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
460                        "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
461                        "    return rgb;\n" +
462                        "}\n" +
463                        "void main()\n" +
464                        "{\n" +
465                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
466                        "  vec3 luv = rgb2luv(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
467                        "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(pow(luv.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.z + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
468                        "  luv.yz = (luv.yz * v_tweak.y * 2.0) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
469                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
470                        "}";
471        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
472        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
473        return shader;
474    }
475
476    @Override
477    public void begin () {
478        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
479        renderCalls = 0;
480
481        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
482        if (customShader != null)
483            customShader.bind();
484        else
485            shader.bind();
486        setupMatrices();
487
488        drawing = true;
489    }
490
491    @Override
492    public void end () {
493        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
494        if (idx > 0) flush();
495        lastTexture = null;
496        drawing = false;
497
498        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
499        gl.glDepthMask(true);
500        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
501    }
502
503    @Override
504    public void setColor (Color tint) {
505        color = tint.toFloatBits();
506    }
507
508    /**
509     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#clamp(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
510     * For the H/S/L parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
511     * value. For H/S/L, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
512     * @see ColorTools#clamp(float, float, float, float)
513     * @param H hue; additive; from 0 to 1, with red at 0, orange above red, yellow above orange, etc.
514     * @param S saturation; additive; from 0 to 1, with 0 desaturating and 1 very saturating
515     * @param L lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (closer to black) to 1 (closer to white)
516     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
517     */
518    @Override
519    public void setColor (float H, float S, float L, float alpha) {
520        color = ColorTools.clamp(H, S, L, alpha);
521    }
522
523    public void setColor (final float color) {
524        setPackedColor(color);
525    }
526
527    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
528        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
529    }
530
531    /**
532     * Sets the color with the given H/S/L and S parameters from 0 to 255.
533     * For the H/S/L parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
534     * value. For H/S/L, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
535     * @see ColorTools#hsluv(float, float, float, float)
536     * @param H hue; additive; from 0 to 255, with red at 0, orange above red, yellow above orange, etc.
537     * @param S saturation; additive; from 0 to 255, with 0 desaturating and 255 very saturating
538     * @param L lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (closer to black) to 255 (closer to white)
539     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
540     */
541    public void setIntColor(int H, int S, int L, int alpha) {
542        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
543                | (L << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (S << 8 & 0xFF00) | (H & 0xFF));
544    }
545
546    @Override
547    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
548        this.color = color;
549    }
550
551    @Override
552    public Color getColor () {
553        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
554        Color color = tempColor;
555        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
556        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
557        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
558        color.a = ((intBits >>> 24) & 0xff) / 255f;
559        return color;
560    }
561
562    @Override
563    public float getPackedColor () {
564        return color;
565    }
566
567    /**
568     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
569     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
570     * @param H hue; multiplicative; probably doesn't work very well and should just be 0.5f
571     * @param S saturation; multiplicative; from 0 to 1, with 0 forcing grayscale and 1 emphasizing saturation
572     * @param L lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
573     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
574     */
575    public void setTweak (float H, float S, float L, float contrast) {
576        tweak = ColorTools.clamp(H, S, L, contrast);
577    }
578    /**
579     * Sets the tweak using a single packed CIELAB float.
580     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
581     * @param tweak a packed CIELAB float, with contrast instead of alpha
582     */
583    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
584        this.tweak = tweak;
585    }
586    
587    public float getTweak () {
588        return tweak;
589    }
590
591    /**
592     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: H (8 bits), S (8 bits), L (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
593     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x8020A06E, which doesn't change hue (using the default 0x80),
594     * significantly reduces colorfulness with S multiplier 0x20 (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale),
595     * raises lightness somewhat with L multiplier 0xA0 (above the neutral point of 0x80), and slightly reduces contrast
596     * (with contrast and the ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
597     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with L in the most significant bits and contrast in least
598     */
599    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
600        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
601    }
602
603    /**
604     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 128 is a neutral value that should have
605     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (128, 128, 128, 128)} will effectively remove the tweak.
606     * @param H hue; multiplicative; probably doesn't work very well and should just be 128
607     * @param S saturation; multiplicative; from 0 to 255, with 0 forcing grayscale and 255 emphasizing saturation
608     * @param L lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 255 (doubles lightness)
609     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
610     */
611    public void setIntTweak(int H, int S, int L, int contrast) {
612        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
613                | (L << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (S << 8 & 0xFF00) | (H & 0xFF));
614    }
615
616    /**
617     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
618     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time, using two packed floats.
619     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
620     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
621     */
622    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
623        setColor(color);
624        setTweak(tweak);
625    }
626
627    /**
628     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
629     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
630     * @param addH hue; additive; from 0 to 1, with red at 0, orange above red, yellow above orange, etc.
631     * @param addS saturation; additive; from 0 to 1, with 0 desaturating and 1 very saturating
632     * @param addL lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (closer to black) to 1 (closer to white)
633     * @param mulAlpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
634     * @param mulH hue; multiplicative; probably doesn't work very well and should just be 0.5f
635     * @param mulS saturation; multiplicative; from 0 to 1, with 0 forcing grayscale and 1 emphasizing saturation
636     * @param mulL lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
637     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
638     */
639    public void setTweakedColor(final float addH, final float addS,
640                                final float addL, final float mulAlpha,
641                                final float mulH, final float mulS,
642                                final float mulL, final float contrast) {
643        setColor(addH, addS, addL, mulAlpha);
644        setTweak(mulH, mulS, mulL, contrast);
645    }
646
647    @Override
648    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
649                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
650        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
651
652        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
653
654        if (texture != lastTexture)
655            switchTexture(texture);
656        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
657            flush();
658
659        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
660        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
661        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
662        float fx = -originX;
663        float fy = -originY;
664        float fx2 = width - originX;
665        float fy2 = height - originY;
666
667        // scale
668        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
669            fx *= scaleX;
670            fy *= scaleY;
671            fx2 *= scaleX;
672            fy2 *= scaleY;
673        }
674
675        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
676        final float p1x = fx;
677        final float p1y = fy;
678        final float p2x = fx;
679        final float p2y = fy2;
680        final float p3x = fx2;
681        final float p3y = fy2;
682        final float p4x = fx2;
683        final float p4y = fy;
684
685        float x1;
686        float y1;
687        float x2;
688        float y2;
689        float x3;
690        float y3;
691        float x4;
692        float y4;
693
694        // rotate
695        if (rotation != 0) {
696            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
697            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
698
699            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
700            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
701
702            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
703            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
704
705            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
706            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
707
708            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
709            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
710        } else {
711            x1 = p1x;
712            y1 = p1y;
713
714            x2 = p2x;
715            y2 = p2y;
716
717            x3 = p3x;
718            y3 = p3y;
719
720            x4 = p4x;
721            y4 = p4y;
722        }
723
724        x1 += worldOriginX;
725        y1 += worldOriginY;
726        x2 += worldOriginX;
727        y2 += worldOriginY;
728        x3 += worldOriginX;
729        y3 += worldOriginY;
730        x4 += worldOriginX;
731        y4 += worldOriginY;
732
733        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
734        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
735        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
736        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
737
738        if (flipX) {
739            float tmp = u;
740            u = u2;
741            u2 = tmp;
742        }
743
744        if (flipY) {
745            float tmp = v;
746            v = v2;
747            v2 = tmp;
748        }
749
750        final float color = this.color;
751        final float tweak = this.tweak;
752        final int idx = this.idx;
753        vertices[idx] = x1;
754        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
755        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
756        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
757        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
758        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
759
760        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
761        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
762        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
763        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
764        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
765        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
766
767        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
768        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
769        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
770        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
771        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
772        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
773
774        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
775        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
776        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
777        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
778        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
779        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
780        this.idx = idx + 24;
781    }
782
783    @Override
784    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
785                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
786        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
787
788        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
789
790        if (texture != lastTexture)
791            switchTexture(texture);
792        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
793            flush();
794
795        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
796        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
797        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
798        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
799        final float fx2 = x + width;
800        final float fy2 = y + height;
801
802        if (flipX) {
803            float tmp = u;
804            u = u2;
805            u2 = tmp;
806        }
807
808        if (flipY) {
809            float tmp = v;
810            v = v2;
811            v2 = tmp;
812        }
813
814        final float color = this.color;
815        final float tweak = this.tweak;
816        final int idx = this.idx;
817        vertices[idx] = x;
818        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
819        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
820        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
821        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
822        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
823
824        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
825        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
826        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
827        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
828        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
829        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
830
831        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
832        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
833        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
834        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
835        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
836        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
837
838        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
839        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
840        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
841        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
842        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
843        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
844        this.idx = idx + 24;
845    }

862        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
863        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
864
865        final float color = this.color;
866        final float tweak = this.tweak;
867        final int idx = this.idx;

877        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
878        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
879        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
880        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
881
882        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
883        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
884        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
885        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
886        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
887        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
888
889        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
890        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
891        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
892        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
893        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
894        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;

949
950    @Override
951    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
952        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
953
954        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
955
956        if (texture != lastTexture)
957            switchTexture(texture);
958        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
959            flush();
960
961        final float fx2 = x + width;
962        final float fy2 = y + height;
963        final float u = 0;
964        final float v = 1;
965        final float u2 = 1;
966        final float v2 = 0;
967
968        final float color = this.color;
969        final float tweak = this.tweak;
970        final int idx = this.idx;
971        vertices[idx] = x;
972        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
973        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
974        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
975        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
976        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
977
978        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
979        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
980        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
981        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
982        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
983        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
984
985        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
986        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
987        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
988        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
989        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
990        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
991
992        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
993        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
994        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
995        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
996        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
997        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
998        this.idx = idx + 24;
999    }
1000
1001    /**
1002     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
1003     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
1004     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
1005     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
1006     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
1007     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
1008     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
1009     */
1010    @Override
1011    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
1012        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1013
1014        count = (count / 5) * 6;
1015        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
1016        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1017        if (texture != lastTexture)
1018            switchTexture(texture);
1019        else {
1020            remainingVertices -= idx;
1021            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
1022                flush();
1023                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1024            }
1025        }
1026        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
1027        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1028
1029        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
1030        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
1031        ////new way, thanks mgsx
1032        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
1033            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1034            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1035            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1036            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1037            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1038            vertices[v++] = tweak;
1039        }
1040        idx += copyCount;
1041        count -= copyCount;
1042        while (count > 0) {
1043            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
1044            flush();
1045            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
1046            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
1047            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
1048            ////new way, thanks mgsx
1049            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
1050                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1051                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1052                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1053                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1054                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1055                vertices[v++] = tweak;
1056            }
1057            idx += copyCount;
1058            count -= copyCount;
1059        }
1060    }
1061
1062    /**
1063     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
1064     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
1065     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
1066     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
1067     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
1068     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
1069     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
1070     */
1071    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
1072        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1073
1074        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
1075        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1076        if (texture != lastTexture)
1077            switchTexture(texture);
1078        else {
1079            remainingVertices -= idx;
1080            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
1081                flush();
1082                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1083            }
1084        }
1085        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
1086
1087        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
1088        idx += copyCount;
1089        count -= copyCount;
1090        while (count > 0) {
1091            offset += copyCount;
1092            flush();
1093            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
1094            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
1095            idx += copyCount;
1096            count -= copyCount;
1097        }
1098    }
1099
1100    @Override
1101    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
1102        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
1103    }

1105    @Override
1106    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
1107        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1108
1109        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1110
1111        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1112        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1113            switchTexture(texture);
1114        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1115            flush();
1116        }
1117        final float fx2 = x + width;
1118        final float fy2 = y + height;
1119        final float u = region.getU();
1120        final float v = region.getV2();
1121        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1122        final float v2 = region.getV();
1123
1124        final float color = this.color;
1125        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1126        final int idx = this.idx;
1127        vertices[idx] = x;
1128        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
1129        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1130        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1131        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1132        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1133
1134        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
1135        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
1136        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1137        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1138        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1139        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1140
1141        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
1142        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
1143        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1144        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1145        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1146        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1147
1148        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
1149        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
1150        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1151        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1152        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1153        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1154        this.idx = idx + 24;
1155    }
1156
1157    @Override
1158    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1159                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
1160        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1161
1162        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1163
1164        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1165        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1166            switchTexture(texture);
1167        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1168            flush();
1169
1170        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1171        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1172        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1173        float fx = -originX;
1174        float fy = -originY;
1175        float fx2 = width - originX;
1176        float fy2 = height - originY;
1177
1178        // scale
1179        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1180            fx *= scaleX;
1181            fy *= scaleY;
1182            fx2 *= scaleX;
1183            fy2 *= scaleY;
1184        }
1185
1186        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1187        final float p1x = fx;
1188        final float p1y = fy;
1189        final float p2x = fx;
1190        final float p2y = fy2;
1191        final float p3x = fx2;
1192        final float p3y = fy2;
1193        final float p4x = fx2;
1194        final float p4y = fy;
1195
1196        float x1;
1197        float y1;
1198        float x2;
1199        float y2;
1200        float x3;
1201        float y3;
1202        float x4;
1203        float y4;
1204
1205        // rotate
1206        if (rotation != 0) {
1207            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1208            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1209
1210            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1211            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1212
1213            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1214            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1215
1216            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1217            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1218
1219            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1220            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1221        } else {
1222            x1 = p1x;
1223            y1 = p1y;
1224
1225            x2 = p2x;
1226            y2 = p2y;
1227
1228            x3 = p3x;
1229            y3 = p3y;
1230
1231            x4 = p4x;
1232            y4 = p4y;
1233        }
1234
1235        x1 += worldOriginX;
1236        y1 += worldOriginY;
1237        x2 += worldOriginX;
1238        y2 += worldOriginY;
1239        x3 += worldOriginX;
1240        y3 += worldOriginY;
1241        x4 += worldOriginX;
1242        y4 += worldOriginY;
1243
1244        final float u = region.getU();
1245        final float v = region.getV2();
1246        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1247        final float v2 = region.getV();
1248
1249        final float color = this.color;
1250        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1251        final int idx = this.idx;
1252        vertices[idx] = x1;
1253        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1254        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1255        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1256        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1257        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1258
1259        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1260        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1261        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1262        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1263        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1264        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1265
1266        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1267        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1268        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1269        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1270        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1271        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1272
1273        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1274        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1275        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1276        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1277        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1278        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1279        this.idx = idx + 24;
1280    }
1281
1282    @Override
1283    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1284                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1285        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1286
1287        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1288
1289        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1290        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1291            switchTexture(texture);
1292        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1293            flush();
1294
1295        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1296        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1297        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1298        float fx = -originX;
1299        float fy = -originY;
1300        float fx2 = width - originX;
1301        float fy2 = height - originY;
1302
1303        // scale
1304        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1305            fx *= scaleX;
1306            fy *= scaleY;
1307            fx2 *= scaleX;
1308            fy2 *= scaleY;
1309        }
1310
1311        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1312        final float p1x = fx;
1313        final float p1y = fy;
1314        final float p2x = fx;
1315        final float p2y = fy2;
1316        final float p3x = fx2;
1317        final float p3y = fy2;
1318        final float p4x = fx2;
1319        final float p4y = fy;
1320
1321        float x1;
1322        float y1;
1323        float x2;
1324        float y2;
1325        float x3;
1326        float y3;
1327        float x4;
1328        float y4;
1329
1330        // rotate
1331        if (rotation != 0) {
1332            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1333            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1334
1335            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1336            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1337
1338            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1339            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1340
1341            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1342            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1343
1344            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1345            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1346        } else {
1347            x1 = p1x;
1348            y1 = p1y;
1349
1350            x2 = p2x;
1351            y2 = p2y;
1352
1353            x3 = p3x;
1354            y3 = p3y;
1355
1356            x4 = p4x;
1357            y4 = p4y;
1358        }
1359
1360        x1 += worldOriginX;
1361        y1 += worldOriginY;
1362        x2 += worldOriginX;
1363        y2 += worldOriginY;
1364        x3 += worldOriginX;
1365        y3 += worldOriginY;
1366        x4 += worldOriginX;
1367        y4 += worldOriginY;
1368
1369        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1370        if (clockwise) {
1371            u1 = region.getU2();
1372            v1 = region.getV2();
1373            u2 = region.getU();
1374            v2 = region.getV2();
1375            u3 = region.getU();
1376            v3 = region.getV();
1377            u4 = region.getU2();
1378            v4 = region.getV();
1379        } else {
1380            u1 = region.getU();
1381            v1 = region.getV();
1382            u2 = region.getU2();
1383            v2 = region.getV();
1384            u3 = region.getU2();
1385            v3 = region.getV2();
1386            u4 = region.getU();
1387            v4 = region.getV2();
1388        }
1389
1390        final float color = this.color;
1391        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1392        final int idx = this.idx;
1393        vertices[idx] = x1;
1394        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1395        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1396        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1397        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1398        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1399
1400        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1401        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1402        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1403        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1404        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1405        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1406
1407        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1408        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1409        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1410        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1411        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1412        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1413
1414        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1415        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1416        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1417        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1418        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1419        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1420        this.idx = idx + 24;
1421    }
1422
1423    @Override
1424    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1425        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1426
1427        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1428
1429        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1430        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1431            switchTexture(texture);
1432        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1433            flush();
1434        }
1435
1436        // construct corner points
1437        float x1 = transform.m02;
1438        float y1 = transform.m12;
1439        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1440        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1441        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1442        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1443        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1444        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1445
1446        float u = region.getU();
1447        float v = region.getV2();
1448        float u2 = region.getV2();
1449        float v2 = region.getV();
1450
1451        final float color = this.color;
1452        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1453        final int idx = this.idx;
1454        vertices[idx] = x1;
1455        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1456        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1457        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1458        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1459        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1460
1461        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1462        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1463        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1464        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1465        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1466        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1467
1468        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1469        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1470        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1471        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1472        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1473        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1474
1475        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1476        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1477        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1478        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1479        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1480        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1481        this.idx = idx + 24;
1482    }
1483
1484    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1485    @Override
1486    public void flush () {
1487        if (idx == 0) return;
1488
1489        renderCalls++;
1490        totalRenderCalls++;
1491        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1492        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1493        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1494
1495        lastTexture.bind();
1496        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1497        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1498        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1499        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1500
1501        if (blendingDisabled) {
1502            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1503        } else {
1504            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1505            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1506        }
1507
1508        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1509
1510        idx = 0;
1511    }
1512
1513    @Override
1514    public void disableBlending () {
1515        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1516        flush();
1517        blendingDisabled = true;
1518    }
1519
1520    @Override
1521    public void enableBlending () {
1522        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1523        flush();
1524        blendingDisabled = false;
1525    }
1526
1527    @Override
1528    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1529        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1530    }
1531
1532    @Override
1533    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1534        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1535        flush();
1536        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1537        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1538        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1539        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1540    }
1541
1542    @Override
1543    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1544        return blendSrcFunc;
1545    }
1546
1547    @Override
1548    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1549        return blendDstFunc;
1550    }
1551
1552    @Override
1553    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1554        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1555    }
1556
1557    @Override
1558    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1559        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1560    }
1561
1562    @Override
1563    public void dispose () {
1564        mesh.dispose();
1565        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1566    }
1567
1568    @Override
1569    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1570        return projectionMatrix;
1571    }
1572
1573    @Override
1574    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1575        return transformMatrix;
1576    }
1577
1578    @Override
1579    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1580        if (drawing) flush();
1581        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1582        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1583    }
1584
1585    @Override
1586    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1587        if (drawing) flush();
1588        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1589        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1590    }
1591
1592    protected void setupMatrices () {
1593        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1594        if (customShader != null) {
1595            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1596            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1597        } else {
1598            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1599            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1600        }
1601    }
1602
1603    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1604        flush();
1605        lastTexture = texture;
1606        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1607        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1608    }
1609
1610    @Override
1611    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1612        if (drawing) {
1613            flush();
1614        }
1615        customShader = shader;
1616        if (drawing) {
1617            if (customShader != null)
1618                customShader.bind();
1619            else
1620                this.shader.bind();
1621            setupMatrices();
1622        }
1623    }
1624
1625    @Override
1626    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1627        if (customShader == null) {
1628            return shader;
1629        }
1630        return customShader;
1631    }
1632
1633    @Override
1634    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1635        return !blendingDisabled;
1636    }
1637
1638    public boolean isDrawing () {
1639        return drawing;
1640    }

1642    static public final int Y1 = 1;
1643    static public final int C1 = 2;
1644    static public final int U1 = 3;
1645    static public final int V1 = 4;
1646    static public final int T1 = 5;
1647    static public final int X2 = 6;
1648    static public final int Y2 = 7;
1649    static public final int C2 = 8;
1650    static public final int U2 = 9;
1651    static public final int V2 = 10;
1652    static public final int T2 = 11;
1653    static public final int X3 = 12;
1654    static public final int Y3 = 13;
1655    static public final int C3 = 14;
1656    static public final int U3 = 15;
1657    static public final int V3 = 16;
1658    static public final int T3 = 17;
1659    static public final int X4 = 18;
1660    static public final int Y4 = 19;
1661    static public final int C4 = 20;
1662    static public final int U4 = 21;
1663    static public final int V4 = 22;
1664    static public final int T4 = 23;
